SD_ROM.synopsis: The player has accepted a invitation from Gale's hologram projection to come meet the real Gale at a secluded grove at night. There, they speak about how this may be his last night alive, as they near the heart of the Absolute, where Gale is destined to blow himself up. The player probes his mindset and can try to comfort him. Ultimately the scene may become romantic. Gale may lead the player to a magically-infused sex scene amidst the stars, or the player may determine they should take a more grounded approach.
SD_ROM.how_to_trigger: Queue the Gale's Last Night Alive night through the Origin debug book;Go through the Double's dialogue and proceed to long rest.

SD_ROM_45.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade up on  the player arriving in a secluded grove.

Gale is sitting on the ground, looking up at a spectacular night sky streaked with aurora borealis. (This is an effect that will be used in the spell teaching scene as well.)

Gale gestures, summoning purple, pink, green and yellow will-o'-the-wisps (effects only), basking the scene in a mysterious glow.

Despite being somewhere in the shadow cursed lands, Gale is painting a magical picture that silently attests to his magical prowess. The player approaches Gale and sits down next to him.

SD_ROM_80.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_80.text: I love this time of night.
SD_ROM_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gazing upwards at the night skyNodeContext: Wistful

SD_ROM_14.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_14.text: There's an almost reverent silence that accompanies the peak of darkness, when you'd almost believe the dawn will never break.

SD_ROM_68.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gestures to the sky, rapt.

SD_ROM_33.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_33.text: It's breathtaking, Gale. Is this starry sky your doing?

SD_ROM_122.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_122.text: Indeed. The curse is still present of course - just veiled and at arm's length for now. Not a trick I can repeat often, but tonight? Tonight is different.

SD_ROM_52.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_52.text: You seem especially philosophical this evening. Are you all right?

SD_ROM_134.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_134.text: I will be, soon. I am perhaps just one hard day away from being without any troubles at all.

SD_ROM_73.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_73.text: Why did you summon me here?

SD_ROM_69.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_69.text: I wanted to see you. While I still could.

SD_ROM_108.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_108.text: I'm afraid all of this is just a fantasy.

SD_ROM_64.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_64.text: So it is. But a very fine one.

SD_ROM_59.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_59.text: This may be my last night alive. I wanted it to be under a canopy of beauty and wonder...

SD_ROM_86.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: longing look at the playerNodeContext: Full of longing

SD_ROM_60.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_60.text: I thought this place might bring me peace. I thought it might make the weight of what I must do feel a little lighter... but I am not so sure.
SD_ROM_60.context: NodeContext: A lot on his mind

SD_ROM_56.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_56.text: Is this truly what you want, to die for the promise of Mystra's forgiveness?

SD_ROM_67.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_67.text: Babe or crone, coward or hero, death is assured. Mystra's forgiveness is not. If you knew the end was near, would you not want to ensure it had meaning?

SD_ROM_63.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_63.text: It's a heavy burden, yes - but one you're able for. Think of the good your sacrifice will do.

SD_ROM_30.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_30.text: I am trying. Believe me, I am. The path is set, and I will not stray from it - even as my heart quakes.

SD_ROM_1.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_1.text: I am terrified - I will not claim otherwise. My face could scarcely conceal it even if my words sought to deny it.

SD_ROM_49.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_49.text: There is no point in running from the inevitable. Better to meet it, on my own terms.

SD_ROM_66.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_66.text: Nothing is inevitable. Not when we face it together. You don't have to die.

SD_ROM_31.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_31.text: You sound sure in your course of action then.

SD_ROM_107.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_107.text: Resigned to it, rather. But that is not to say I am without fear. Far from it.

SD_ROM_115.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_115.text: You're right. At least this way, you might take the Absolute down with you.

SD_ROM_9.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_9.text: I can only hope that there are few innocents within the Absolute's reach, when the time comes... and that you will seek safety, far away from me.

SD_ROM_82.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_82.text: Stay with me a while, will you? Day will come all too soon, even in this place.

SD_ROM_61.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_61.text: I'm not going anywhere, Gale. I'll be by your side, whatever dawn brings.

SD_ROM_3.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_3.text: One moment with you could sate me for a lifetime, and prise the fear from my heart. I'm so very glad you came, to share this with me.

SD_ROM_5.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_5.text: I know this is all unreal, but I created it for you. You must know that you're... That you're very special to me.

SD_ROM_112.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_112.text: If things were different, if we were home, I'd have taken the time to do things properly. To say it all better. But time is short.

SD_ROM_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player and Gale kiss seated on the ground. It's relatively chaste.

SD_ROM_105.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_105.text: And you're a bad liar. I lived the life of a hermit for some time before I met you - safer for all, but not conducive to pleasures of the flesh.

SD_ROM_123.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_123.text: A fair assessment - I wish we had more time to practice together.

SD_ROM_15.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_15.text: I hope that wasn't a parting kiss.

SD_ROM_85.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_85.text: Not if I have any say in the matter.

SD_ROM_133.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_133.text: I want it to be perfect - to bond with you in the way that gods do... intertwining our spirits in visions of the Weave.
SD_ROM_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands, a little animated as he describes the possibilities of magic love. The player stands.

SD_ROM_50.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_50.text: How about the perfect night in Waterdeep? Yes... Let's imagine how it would be.

SD_ROM_90.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_90.text: The scene is this: you and I stand in the room that is the centre of my universe.
SD_ROM_90.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches out a hand to his side--fingers expanding on an invisible surface. Aurora-like energy spreads from Gale's hand wiping forming a wall.

The player turns following the glow as it arcs around them and Gale until the shape of a room housing an expansive library is fully realized. There's furniture for study, a chez lounge for rest, and a piano for company.

Closed doors lead to a balcony, and as yet unseen view of Waterdeep.

This is Gale's home and heart of his studies.

SD_ROM_98.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_98.text: The sculptures, the paintings, the walls enlivened by the spines of a thousand books.
SD_ROM_98.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player turns following the glow as it arcs around them and Gale until the shape of a room housing an expansive library is fully realized. There's furniture for study, a chez lounge for rest, and a piano for company.

Closed doors lead to a balcony, and as yet unseen view of Waterdeep.

This is Gale's home and heart of his studies.

SD_ROM_19.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_19.text: The grand piano plays the Lliirian Suites all by itself, and as we look out beyond the arches that lead to the terrace, we see the weary sun take its daily dive into the sea.
SD_ROM_19.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale strolls toward the balcony doors, past the piano.

The Piano starts to play as Gale passes, and the doors open as Gale approaches. He walks out onto the balcony, overlooking a Waterdeep marina sillouetted by a purple skied twilight.

SD_ROM_70.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_70.text: My favourite spot. Many times, evening turned to night and back to daybreak once more while I sat here, lost in words.
SD_ROM_70.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale pauses, breathing in what illusory seabreeze he may.

The player sits on a bench on Gale's balcony, enjoying the conjured sunset. Gale joins them, sitting on the player's left.

A book and bottle of wine sit on a side table next to the bench.

SD_ROM_125.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_125.text: It's called 'The Art of the Night', and it details the first thousand nights of a newlywed king and queen.

SD_ROM_99.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_99.text: That's your perfect? It seems... lonely.

SD_ROM_11.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_11.text: On the contrary. No one is lonely when they have books - except perhaps the illiterate.

SD_ROM_4.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_4.text: This one here is called 'The Art of the Night'. It details the first thousand nights of a newlywed king and queen.

SD_ROM_8.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_8.text: They turned everything they did into an art. The art of conversation. The art of taste, time honoured and newly acquired.

SD_ROM_42.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_42.text: The art of the body. The exploration and acceptance of the self and the other. The art of the night itself.

SD_ROM_128.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_128.text: I say we take a page from their book.

SD_ROM_75.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_75.text: Leave it to you to seduce someone with a book.

SD_ROM_106.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_106.text: Then let's set the book aside an be blank slates on blank sheets, delightfully new.

SD_ROM_23.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_23.text: You're remarkably upfront about your intentions. I like it.

SD_ROM_93.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_93.text: I'm many things, but coy's not one of them.

SD_ROM_95.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_95.text: I'll remind you we're newly acquainted, not newlyweds.

SD_ROM_41.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_41.text: Then we'll start writing the prequel.

SD_ROM_101.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_101.text: I think that sounds delightful - but I don't see a bed.

SD_ROM_6.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_6.text: The stars will be our bed. Come here.

SD_ROM_127.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale leans over and grabs the book from the side table, opens it, and places it between himself and the player, then puts his hand on open book on the page closest to the player.

The player follows suit by placing their hand on the page closest to Gale. Arms crossing, they stair into eachothers eyes which, after a blink, glow with magic. A spectral third eye opens up on each of their foreheads.

A spectral fingers (belonging to a projection of Gale) emerge from the page between the player's fingers, when the magical hand makes contact with the player's their physical hand remains on the page, and their own spectral hand is picked up.

Spectral Gale pulls the player's projection off the bench and into the air above their physical bodies. Buried in the heart of Gale's projection sits a dark orb.

SD_ROM_48.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_48.text: Why confine ourselves to the pleasures of mortal flesh? It is but one stitch in a vast tapestry. Let me show you more.
SD_ROM_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spectal Gale holds the spectral player's hand while hovering above their physical bodies

SD_ROM_18.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_18.text: Show me more. Show me it all.

SD_ROM_17.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_17.text: *Your bodies and minds weave together in a masterpiece of intimacy. Never have you felt such wonder, such love - as vast as the universe itself, and just as heavenly.*
SD_ROM_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black on the narrator telling they had fun that night

SD_ROM_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale pulls the player's spectral form in for a kiss.

SD_ROM_118.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_118.text: When you wake, it will be back at our camp, back in our small, dirty, bloody patch of existence. But stay with me now. There are endless worlds out there. Countless ways to declare love. Infinite ways to express it. Too much for one night...
SD_ROM_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale holds the player close after their kiss

SD_ROM_84.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_84.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player kisses the dark orb at the heart of Gale then kisses him passionately on the lips.



Their fingers spread, their hand merge into one another.



The two spectral figures are a tangle of arms caressing more perfect forms, exploring, merging into a singular shape, a divine being slowly spinning in the twilight air.

SD_ROM_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera cuts wide. Fade to black.

SD_ROM_24.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_24.text: It's beautiful, but its you I want to be with. The man, not the illusion.

SD_ROM_13.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Physical Gale's finger snaps.

The player and Gale have returned to a quiet night in the secluded grove. All illusions dispelled.

SD_ROM_29.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_29.text: The old ways then. If that is what you wish, so be it.
SD_ROM_29.context: NodeContext: Tactful, bowing to the player's desires.

SD_ROM_20.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale gestures for the player to stand next to him and sit on what must be an invisible piece of furniture.

The player walks over to him and looks at where they're supposed to sit and playfull feins doubt before throw their weight into the empty space.

Below them a four poster bed materialize in the same aurora life magic materialization Gale used to produce his room.

SD_ROM_39.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_39.text: A small gesture towards your comfort.
SD_ROM_39.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale gesture his hands toward the bed
The player sit pats the bed next to them inviting him to join.

SD_ROM_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player on the bed. He put his knee on the bed and goes for a kiss while liying down and putting the player on his back.The camera cuts wide. Fade to black.

SD_ROM_88.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_88.text: I want to be with the real Gale - the man, not the fantasy.

SD_ROM_28.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_28.text: This is a pleasant fantasy, but no more. Time to return to the real world.

SD_ROM_124.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_124.text: As you like. Thank you, for spending this time with me. If only there was more.

SD_ROM_92.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_92.text: Up all night reading? I do love that rebellious streak of yours...

SD_ROM_36.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_36.text: Allow me to live dangerously while I still can.

SD_ROM_77.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_77.text: I don't need illusions. I want the Gale standing right in front of me.

SD_ROM_44.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_44.text: Are you sure...? I could conjure up any sight that you could dream of, and a few you could not. I could use the Weave to make us feel sensations beyond reckoning. I could do more than woo you. I could wow you.

SD_ROM_16.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_16.text: You don't need to impress me, Gale. I'm no deity.

SD_ROM_26.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_26.text: Yes, you are. Trust me, I would know. Let's do it your way then. So long as it's with you.

SD_ROM_79.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_79.text: I'm in love with you too.

SD_ROM_12.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_12.text: I'm in love with you too.

SD_ROM_72.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_72.text: That's a relief. It would be a shame to spend my final hours making an ass of myself.
SD_ROM_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: relieved chuckleNodeContext: relieved chuckle

SD_ROM_32.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_32.text: I'm in love with you too.

SD_ROM_47.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_47.text: I'd give a lot to be able to kiss you right now. But your presence itself is more than enough. A night stargazing with you is the greatest gift I could ask for.

SD_ROM_119.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_119.text: I don't feel the same way.

SD_ROM_78.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_78.text: I see... well perhaps this is for the best. Should my time be short, you will not be wounded too deeply by my absence.

SD_ROM_21.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_21.text: Thank you, for spending this time with me. I think I want to be alone now.

SD_ROM_71.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_71.text: Yes... but there is so much to live for, and so few moments in which to house it all.

SD_ROM_132.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_132.text: Damn you. Damn you for giving me so much to care about. Our friends, our adventures... this would have been so much easier if it was just me. But it isn't.

SD_ROM_7.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_7.text: If there is a way - any way - to save all that's grown dear to me, I want to seize it. I just can't fathom what that might be, other than to fail Mystra and condemn the world.

SD_ROM_116.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_116.text: Stay with me, will you? I don't want to think of it any more, but I don't want to be alone either.

SD_ROM_74.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_74.text: Stay with him and watch the stars in silence.

SD_ROM_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player and Gale silently watch the stars, The scene fades out,

SD_ROM_121.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_121.text: I'd rather not listen to you wallowing in self-pity. Good night, Gale.

SD_ROM_104.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_104.text: A good night indeed. The fairest I can imagine...
SD_ROM_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up to leave. Gale sadly looks away from them, returning his attention to the stars.

SD_ROM_94.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_94.text: Your words are those of a dear friend, or a lover even. But this is no time for delusions - fate threw us together, and mutual survival kept us together.

SD_ROM_40.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_40.text: Those bonds will soon break. But you were a worthy ally, and could have become much more, in other circumstances. Let us just enjoy the view together. We will leave the world a better place than it is tonight.

SD_ROM_34.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_34.text: Heartening words - if only they came from the lips of another. This is no time for delusion - we are not close, you and I.

SD_ROM_114.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_114.text: But it will not matter, soon enough. Let us just enjoy the view, in silence. We will leave the world a better place than it is tonight.

SD_ROM_58.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_58.text: Why are you so sure it's inevitable? We haven't even found this 'Heart of the Absolute' yet.

SD_ROM_117.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_117.text: I can feel it - ever since we set foot in this strange, corrupted land. The closer we get, the heavier my own heart becomes.

SD_ROM_55.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_55.text: You speak as if this affects you alone. How many will die if you unleash what's inside you?

SD_ROM_126.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_126.text: Fewer than if the Absolute goes unchecked. I don't want to kill, and I don't want to die... but inaction will lead to bloodshed all the same.

SD_ROM_96.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_96.text: Afraid? No, I am terrified. But fear or courage or reason cannot change the charge I've been given.

SD_ROM_37.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_37.text: I refuse to believe this is the end. We'll find another way, I promise.

SD_ROM_89.speaker: Gale
SD_ROM_89.text: Thank you. But even if we do find another way, perhaps this is the right way. The end fate wishes for me.
